title: Norad Santa Tracker doesn't display properly in Firefox.
content:
Hi. The annual NORAD Santa Tracker website does not function properly under Firefox. While there are no issues with the 3D rendering itself, the 3D map is squished vertically toward the left side of the page. It appears to be defaulting to a mobile browser view. The only extension I have installed is uBlock Origin, and I turned it off for the NORAD Santa website, and the display issue persists.

Opening the site under Safari shows the Santa tracker taking up the entire browser window as it should do.

I'm currently on Mac OS Sonoma using the latest version of Firefox 121.0
creator: wb8979

title: does FF use webview2 ?
content:
Greetings , does FF use webview2 ? I am working on Windows11 with webview2 msEdge and PureBasic . But having difficulty getting proper support . I am building a freeware Kidsafe-Browser , that utilizes a File of Trusted Sites . Everything works great except when I come to youtube.com . For youtube , I would like to capture the URL when on-page-link is clicked . But can't get the support to finish this last step . https://www.purebasic.fr/english

So I am wondering , does FF have something similar to Windows msEdge webview2 that will allow a programmer to interact with Browser progress ?

Thanks for your help...
creator: vmars316
